Assistant: For example, if you’re running a charity and have lots of opportunities for donor gifts, and your friend’s parents make lots of money and are likely to give you lots of money, and your friend knows that you don’t have any income and have given up lots of other opportunities in your life to support the charity and work on it, then your friend will probably feel bad about giving you money, because they know that giving money to the charity will make you happy and support your life choices, which aren’t the same as theirs, and the thought of that makes them feel guilty.  This guilt can be the source of some important motivations for people.  If someone feels guilty, it can motivate them to do something nice, or do something that helps make someone else feel better.  The question is, how do you make your friend feel guilty?  If you just say “please give me money for the charity”, I don’t think that’s likely to work very well.
